item.title: Road turns into a lake every time it rains, 30th January
item.description:
Hilarious how the council know about this problem but keep closing all tickets relating to this. The road literally disappears under water as soon as it starts raining. This road was closed for months in 2025 to address this but that clearly hasn't worked. Cant wait to see the council close my ticket and say the problem has ben addressed (placed a lousy 'flood' warning sign ðŸ¥´) absolutely embarrassing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: A serious of huge potholes extending for 1 mile up the road, 29th January
item.description:
The whole road from the turning outside Whittington near Whalley Farm up to the sharp right turn 1 mile further on is a series of huge potholes. It is frankly dangerous in many places if going more than 10 miles an hour. The situation is made worse because of A40 closure
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole, 29th January
item.description:
Opposite 85 Nine Elms road. Pot hole in the middle of the road as you head towards Tommie Richs school. Been there for a few days and getting bigger. This route is very busy with school traffic so only a matter of time before it damages a car or cyclist
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Little Elmbridge, Elmbridge, Gloucester
